data.title: Ridiculous comments and claims made by City Councillors
data.meta_description:
While being rather vague on the details of his call to action.

Well, yeah, he's one of those entrenched power-hoarders, what do you want from him? ;)
data.text:
In Sun today, S-A Levy:

Nine minutes into an emergency North York community council meeting at lunchtime Monday, Cllr. David Shiner moved that a new street in his ward be named “Karen’s Way.”

The street, which runs east to west between Rean Dr. and Barberry Pl., is located in his Willowdale ward.

A majority of lemmings on the NYCC — Maria Augimeri, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata, Josh Colle and of course Shiner– supported the motion without question.

While the cost is not an issue — it’s about $500 to create a new street sign — the choice of name is.

While sources tell me Shiner would not confirm who the “Karen” is in “Karen’s Way,” I might note that Karen Wood was Shiner’s executive assistant for many years at City Hall (I was there when she worked for him and found her to be a nice lady) — until she became his life partner.

Frances Nunziata is part of Etobicoke - York Community council so not sure how she would have been there or able to vote?

It is a Sue-Ann article so why do you expect total accuracy? :->

Quite an interview with Glenn De Baeremaeker. He tells @DavidNickle that in hindsight, he never should have supported the one-stop Scarborough subway that he and Mayor John Tory spent the past three years defending, calling it a compromise and a "mistake."

The rats are jumping the ship as the real costs come home to roost- every choice made on the Scarborough subway has been a bad one (not choosing the RT corridor, removing stations, etc.).

But anyways - De Baeremaeker:
